sys_remote_update_set.description:
Postmaster enables intelligent routing of inbound emails to tasks:
-Multiple ordered Email Routing Rules can be configured to determine routing behavior. -Use conditions such as 'Recipient is' or 'Body contains' to route intelligently. -From inbound emails, create records on any task-based table. -Automatically apply a chosen template to any created record. -Configure where the 'subject' and 'body' of the email should be copied. -For Service Catalog order creation, automatically apply a Catalog item and generate the appropriate REQ>RITM hierarchy. -Scripting capability for advanced requirements
Notes: -If no matching Email Routing Rules are found, the instance will continue to process existing Inbound actions. -To maintain the original 'To' address when redirecting email from your servers to ServiceNow, be sure 'relay' email messages.
sys_remote_update_set.name: Postmaster Email Routing v1.8

sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update><sys_ui_section caption="" section_id="4bae650adc44210002adbc7f5f0ed2a4" sys_domain="global" table="email_routing_rule" version="3" view=""><sys_ui_annotation action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><is_plain_text>true</is_plain_text><sys_created_by>ben.hollifield@snc</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2016-06-13 22:42:30</sys_created_on><sys_id>34a38db8134ca600c794b7a12244b045</sys_id><sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>ben.hollifield@snc</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2016-06-13 22:42:30</sys_updated_on><text><p>Email Routing Rules determine the tasks that are created from inbound email.</p><ul><li><b>Destination table</b>: Table where the record will be created.</li><li><b>Email subject to</b>: Field where the email subject will be copied.</li><li><b>Email body to</b>: Field where the email body will be copied.</li><li><b>Order</b>: Order in which rules are processed. Execution will stop after first match.</li><li><b>Template to apply</b>: Pre-built template to apply to the record - used for auto-population of record values.</li><li><b>Apply script</b>: Enable scripting to set fields on the resulting record.</li><li><b>Catalog item to order</b>: Service Catalog item to order from email (only applies to Request & Requested Item tables).</li><li><b>Email condition</b>: Email conditions under which to use this rule.<br />Use terms like '<em>To is fieldservices@example.com</em>' or '<em>Body contains heartbleed virus</em>'. To explore available values, look at <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><a title="existing received email records" href="/sys_email_list.do?sysparm_query=type%3Dreceived%5Esys_created_onONThis%20week%40javascript%3Ags.beginningOfThisWeek()%40javascript%3Ags.endOfThisWeek()" target="_blank">existing received email records</a></span>. Note that recipients, subject, and body of emails are all forced to lowercase, so use lowercase values for your conditions against these fields.</li></ul><p><i>Note: To maintain the original 'To' address when redirecting email from your servers to ServiceNow, be sure to 'relay' email messages.</i></p></text><type display_value="Info Box Blue">753f88a80f930000b12e6903cfe01206</type></sys_ui_annotation><sys_ui_element
